title: Section 302 – Punishment for Murder
description: Defines the punishment for committing murder under the IPC.
content: The primary acts related to murder in the IPC are: Section 299 (Defines culpable homicide), Section 300 (Defines murder, specifying the conditions under which culpable homicide becomes murder), and Section 302 (Prescribes the punishment for murder). Other related acts include Section 304 (Deals with punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder) and Section 304A (Addresses causing death by negligence).

title: Section 375 – Rape
description: Defines the offence of rape under IPC.
content: The primary section of the IPC dealing with the definition of rape is Section 375. This section defines what constitutes 'rape' under the law. Section 376 of the IPC and its sub-sections prescribe different levels of punishment, such as: 376(1) for general punishment, 376(2) for specific offenders, 376(A) for causing death, 376(AB) for offenses against minors, and various other sub-sections (376(B), 376(C), 376(D), 376(DA), and 376(DB)) addressing specific circumstances like gang rape.

title: Section 379 – Theft
description: Punishment for committing theft under IPC.
content: Whoever commits theft shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Section 10 – Law of Contract
description: Defines the essential elements of a valid contract under the Indian Contract Act.
content: All agreements are contracts if they are made by the free consent of parties competent to contract, for a lawful consideration and with a lawful object.

title: Section 73 – Compensation for Breach of Contract
description: Details the right to claim damages when a contract is broken.
content: When a contract has been broken, the party who suffers is entitled to receive compensation for any loss or damage caused to him thereby.

title: Section 5 – Transfer of Property Act
description: Defines what constitutes the transfer of property in India.
content: In the following sections 'transfer of property' means an act by which a living person conveys property, in present or in future, to one or more other living persons.
